entry.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18709)
entry.content:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

entry.title: We are live with Governor Polis to launch the Build Back...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

We are live with Governor Polis to launch the Build Back Stronger Statewide Listening Tour!

Governor Jared Polis was live.

I’m joining legislative leaders from both parties and State Treasurer Dave Young to announce the launch of the Build Back Stronger Statewide Listening Tour!

entry.title: “In the coming weeks, Democrats who run the legislature are...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“In the coming weeks, Democrats who run the legislature are primed to introduce a series of proposals that will, among other things, limit use of the sedative ketamine by first responders; limit and/or ban no-knock warrants; and... “demilitarize” police forces by restricting their use of military surplus vehicles and equipment.”

More policing charges are being proposed in the Colorado Legislature, including limiting the use of the sedative ketamine by first responders, limiting or banning no-knock warrants and restricting …

denverpost.com

2020 brought historic changes to policing in Colorado. Here’s what lawmakers want to do next.

More policing charges are being proposed in the Colorado Legislature, including limiting the use of the sedative ketamine by first responders, limiting or banning no-knock warrants and restricting …More policing charges are being proposed in the Colorado Legislature, including limiting the use of the sedative ketamine by first responders, limiting or banning no-knock warrants and restricting …

entry.title: "Police brutality cases that capture public attention...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Police brutality cases that capture public attention follow a familiar pattern: first relentless media coverage, then local or national outrage, and then — if charges are ever brought against the officers involved — the drawn-out legal process. But what happens when this public cycle ends?"

The Marshall Project

Jon Henry's photography project seeks to convey the impact of police violence on Black families.

themarshallproject.org

“Stranger Fruit”: Black Mothers and the Fear of Police Brutality

Jon Henry's photography project seeks to convey the impact of police violence on Black families.Jon Henry's photography project seeks to convey the impact of police violence on Black families.

entry.title: "The oppressive systems we live and work under have created...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The oppressive systems we live and work under have created a burnout epidemic, and this is all the worse for Black women and femmes who have a long legacy of exhaustion at the hands of white supremacist heteropatriarchy"

ELLE

Racial justice educator and author Rachel Ricketts on why society needs to reckon with the stress and trauma it inflicts on Black women.

elle.com

Black Women Are in the Midst of a Burnout Epidemic

Racial justice educator and author Rachel Ricketts on why society needs to reckon with the stress and trauma it inflicts on Black women.Racial justice educator and author Rachel Ricketts on why society needs to reckon with the stress and trauma it inflicts on Black women.

entry.title: "No one sets out to be a Black Lives Matter martyr. But...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"No one sets out to be a Black Lives Matter martyr. But somewhere along the way last year, as masked marchers from Louisville to Las Vegas chanted her name, Breonna Taylor became a symbol of change."

USA TODAY

Activist-scholar Kimberlé Crenshaw wants you to remember that Black men aren't the only ones who lose their lives to police violence.

usatoday.com

Breonna Taylor and hundreds of Black women have died at the hands of police. The movement to say their names is growing.

Activist-scholar Kimberlé Crenshaw wants you to remember that Black men aren't the only ones who lose their lives to police violence.Activist-scholar Kimberlé Crenshaw wants you to remember that Black men aren't the only ones who lose their lives to police violence.

entry.title: "The 2020 uprisings against police violence offered a...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The 2020 uprisings against police violence offered a direct challenge to systemic racism and a demand for revolution...class politics of this moment share a lot in common with the Black feminist goal of ending all forms of oppression and the socialist objective of overthrowing the existing power structure."

TeenVouge

The term was never meant to be exclusionary.

teenvogue.com

This Is the Real Meaning of Identity Politics

The term was never meant to be exclusionary.The term was never meant to be exclusionary.

entry.title: "The House of Representatives passed an amendment Wednesday...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The House of Representatives passed an amendment Wednesday that would create the first grant program dedicated to supporting LGBTQ survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking."

NBC News

LGBTQ survivors, especially trans women of color, have been overlooked by the act, Rep. Ayanna Pressley, D-Mass., said.

nbcnews.com

Violence Against Women Act to offer support to LGBTQ survivors

LGBTQ survivors, especially trans women of color, have been overlooked by the act, Rep. Ayanna Pressley, D-Mass., said.LGBTQ survivors, especially trans women of color, have been overlooked by the act, Rep. Ayanna Pressley, D-Mass., said.

entry.title: "Many people have been paying increasing attention to the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Many people have been paying increasing attention to the language used to refer to people in relation to feminism and LGBTQ+ activism....Beyond language, many people point to the need to focus more on intersectional feminism by centering on the stories of trans women and women of color."

The Daily Illini

Many people have been paying increasing attention to the language used to refer to people in relation to feminism and LGBTQ+ activism. For example, the words “womxn” and “Latinx” are gaining popularity. Beyond language, many people point to the need to focus more on intersectional feminism b...

dailyillini.com

Intersectional feminism encouraged during Women's History Month

Many people have been paying increasing attention to the language used to refer to people in relation to feminism and LGBTQ+ activism. For example, the words “womxn” and “Latinx” are gaining popularity. Beyond language, many people point to the need to focus more on intersectional feminism b...Many people have been paying increasing attention to the language used to refer to people in relation to feminism and LGBTQ+ activism. For example, the words “womxn” and “Latinx” are gaining popularity. Beyond language, many people point to the need to focus more on intersectional feminism b...

entry.title: "These senseless acts of anti-Asian violence have finally...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"These senseless acts of anti-Asian violence have finally garnered the national attention they deserve, but they have also invoked anti-Black sentiment and reignited the trope of Black-Asian conflict."

The Brookings Institution

Jennifer Lee and Tiffany Huang write that many Asian Americans recognize commonalities with Black Americans and that these public acts of interracial solidarity show what is possible when we imagine empathy and justice.

brookings.edu

Why the trope of Black-Asian conflict in the face of anti-Asian violence dismisses solidarity

Jennifer Lee and Tiffany Huang write that many Asian Americans recognize commonalities with Black Americans and that these public acts of interracial solidarity show what is possible when we imagine empathy and justice.Jennifer Lee and Tiffany Huang write that many Asian Americans recognize commonalities with Black Americans and that these public acts of interracial solidarity show what is possible when we imagine empathy and justice.

entry.title: "Despite recent gains for women across sectors, the gender...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Despite recent gains for women across sectors, the gender pay gap — or the difference in what women are paid compared to men — is stubbornly persistent."

Today Show

Despite recent gains for women across sectors, the gender pay gap — or the difference in what women are paid compared to men — is stubbornly persistent.

today.com

It's been a decade since the Fair Pay Act — why is there still a gender gap?

Despite recent gains for women across sectors, the gender pay gap — or the difference in what women are paid compared to men — is stubbornly persistent.Despite recent gains for women across sectors, the gender pay gap — or the difference in what women are paid compared to men — is stubbornly persistent.

entry.title: Join us as Governor Jared Polis signs Fund Safe Revitalization...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Join us as Governor Jared Polis signs Fund Safe Revitalization of Main Streets into law!

Governor Jared Polis was live.

I’m excited to be in Golden today to sign the Fund Safe Revitalization of Main Streets bill which provides an additional $30 million in state stimulus funding t...o help communities and other public entities modify roadways and fun downtown locations to promote safety, health, and economic activity!

See More

entry.title: "A white gunman was charged Wednesday with killing eight...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A white gunman was charged Wednesday with killing eight people at three Atlanta-area massage parlors in an attack that sent terror through the Asian American community, which has increasingly been targeted during the coronavirus pandemic."

HuffPost

The shootings appear to be at the “intersection of gender-based violence, misogyny and xenophobia,” said Georgia state Rep. Bee Nguyen.

huffpost.com

Massage Spa Attacks Send Terror Through Asian American Community

The shootings appear to be at the “intersection of gender-based violence, misogyny and xenophobia,” said Georgia state Rep. Bee Nguyen.The shootings appear to be at the “intersection of gender-based violence, misogyny and xenophobia,” said Georgia state Rep. Bee Nguyen.

entry.title: "A Georgia sheriff’s captain tried to convince the public...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A Georgia sheriff’s captain tried to convince the public Wednesday morning that a man charged with fatally shooting several people of Asian descent the night before was not motivated by race."

HuffPost

Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.

huffpost.com

Cop Who Said Spa Shooter Wasn’t Racist Against Asians Previously Promoted Racism Against Asians

Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.Cherokee County sheriff's Capt. Jay Baker promoted merchandise last year that demonized the Asian community in relation to COVID-19.

entry.title: “DENVER — Collective grief continues through Colorado's...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“DENVER — Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences.”

Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.

thedenverchannel.com

Members of Denver's Asian American, Pacific Islander communities share collective grief following Atlanta spa shootings

Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.Collective grief continues through Colorado's Asian American and Pacific Islander community, causing fear and uncertainty according to those who shared their lived experiences with Denver7.

entry.title: Tune in to hear me and Narkita Gold Studio discuss THE famous...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Tune in to hear me and Narkita Gold Studio discuss THE famous Black in Denver exhibit that has taken our city by storm.

entry.title: "Colorado lawmakers have introduced several bills this...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Colorado lawmakers have introduced several bills this session meant to shield immigrants from being arrested over civil immigration violations..."

The Denver Post

A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.

denverpost.com

Colorado bills seek to shield immigrants from ICE, provide legal representation

A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.A look at four bills in the Colorado Legislature that would significantly change to how the state interacts with immigrants who are living in the U.S. without legal permission.

entry.title: "Gov. Jared Polis and bipartisan legislative leaders rolled...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Gov. Jared Polis and bipartisan legislative leaders rolled out a long-awaited $700 million stimulus plan Wednesday, dedicating large pots of money to expected areas like highway repairs but also setting aside funds to help large events and to give more sales-tax relief to struggling restaurants."

Denver Business Journal

Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.

bizjournals.com

Polis, legislators unveil $700 million Colorado stimulus package - Denver Business Journal

Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.Legislative leaders said they will seek to turn around the series of bills quickly so that they can be passed quickly and get money into the hands of individuals and businesses.

entry.title: "They mark their intermittent triumphs by the decade: the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"They mark their intermittent triumphs by the decade: the Palmer High School Terrors changed their Eaglebeak mascot from a caricature of an Indian to an actual eagle in the ‘80s; in 1995, the University of Southern Colorado changed its Indians mascot to the ThunderHawks.
And there still are 24 Colorado K-12 schools with native mascots."

The Colorado Sun

COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...

coloradosun.com

25 Colorado schools still had Native American mascots. This week one finally decided to make a change.

COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...COLORADO SPRINGS — When Stephanie Jerome and her family moved a year ago to Colorado Springs, she took her daughter to the Cheyenne Mountain School District office to enroll her in fifth grade. There they learned that the district’s high school sports teams were called Indians. And so she enroll...

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280

Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.
